questions.text: The 'current wars' of the 1890s refers to what historical event?

questionList.text: An argument between two engineers over whether AC or DC current should be used in the electric grid.
A war between circus directors and rampaging elephants. The circus directors won, but only barely.
A heated debate over whether the direction of the current in the Hudson river could be redirected.

questions.text: Nikola Tesla was born in the territory of what modern country (It was part of the Hapsburg Empire at the time he was born, but is today an independent country):
Thomas Edison's Menlo Park laboratory is in what state?
There are a bunch of videos on YouTube of an elephant being shocked to death, claiming that Did Thomas Edison did it to prove a point about AC and DC current. Is this accurate

answerChoices.text: There isn't no hard evidence Edison had anything to do with the electrocution of the elephant. It's an urban legend.
